trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your HTML/JavaScript app | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your HTML/JavaScript app | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your HTML app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your HTML app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your HTML app, including PhoneGap or Cordova apps.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your HTML app, including PhoneGap or Cordova apps.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In the app directory, launch one of the following command files from the **server** subfolder.
trans-unit.target: In the app directory, launch one of the following command files from the **server** subfolder.

trans-unit.source: **launch-windows** (Windows computers)
trans-unit.target: **launch-windows** (Windows computers)

trans-unit.source: **launch-mac.command** (Mac OS X computers)
trans-unit.target: **launch-mac.command** (Mac OS X computers)

trans-unit.source: **launch-linux.sh** (Linux computers)
trans-unit.target: **launch-linux.sh** (Linux computers)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]On a Windows computer, type `R` when PowerShell asks you to confirm that you want to run the script.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]On a Windows computer, type `R` when PowerShell asks you to confirm that you want to run the script.

trans-unit.source: Your web browser might warn you to not run the script because it was downloaded from the internet.
trans-unit.target: Your web browser might warn you to not run the script because it was downloaded from the internet.

trans-unit.source: When this happens, you must request that the browser proceed to load the script.
trans-unit.target: When this happens, you must request that the browser proceed to load the script.

trans-unit.source: This starts a web server on your local computer to host the new app.
trans-unit.target: This starts a web server on your local computer to host the new app.

trans-unit.source: Open the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser to start the app.
trans-unit.target: Open the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser to start the app.

trans-unit.source: The data fails to load.
trans-unit.target: The data fails to load.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Open the script debugger for your web browser and reload the page.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Open the script debugger for your web browser and reload the page.

trans-unit.source: Verify that an access denied error occurs.
trans-unit.target: Verify that an access denied error occurs.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to allow authentication before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to allow authentication before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Because the login is performed in a popup, you should invoke the **login** method from a button's click event.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Because the login is performed in a popup, you should invoke the **login** method from a button's click event.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, many browsers will suppress the login window.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, many browsers will suppress the login window.

trans-unit.source: Open the project file index.html, locate the H1 element and under it add the following code snippet:
trans-unit.target: Open the project file index.html, locate the H1 element and under it add the following code snippet:

trans-unit.source: This enables you to login to Mobile Services from the page.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to login to Mobile Services from the page.

trans-unit.source: In the app.js file, locate the line of code at the very bottom of the file that calls to the refreshTodoItems function, and replace it with the following code:
trans-unit.target: In the app.js file, locate the line of code at the very bottom of the file that calls to the refreshTodoItems function, and replace it with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This creates a set of functions to handle the authentication process.
trans-unit.target: This creates a set of functions to handle the authentication process.

trans-unit.source: The user is authenticated by using a Facebook login.
trans-unit.target: The user is authenticated by using a Facebook login.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider other than Facebook, change the value passed to the **login** method above to one of the following: *microsoftaccount*, *facebook*, *twitter*, *google*, or *aad*.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider other than Facebook, change the value passed to the **login** method above to one of the following: *microsoftaccount*, *facebook*, *twitter*, *google*, or *aad*.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT]In a PhoneGap app, you must also add the following plugins to the project:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT]In a PhoneGap app, you must also add the following plugins to the project:

trans-unit.source: Go back to the browser where your app is running, and refresh the page.
trans-unit.target: Go back to the browser where your app is running, and refresh the page.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]When you use Internet Explorer, you may receive the error after login: Cannot reach window opener. It may be on a different Internet Explorer zone.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]When you use Internet Explorer, you may receive the error after login: Cannot reach window opener. It may be on a different Internet Explorer zone.

trans-unit.source: This occurs because the pop-up runs in a different security zone (internet) from localhost (intranet).
trans-unit.target: This occurs because the pop-up runs in a different security zone (internet) from localhost (intranet).

trans-unit.source: This only affects apps during development using localhost.
trans-unit.target: This only affects apps during development using localhost.

trans-unit.source: As a workaround, open the **Security** tab of **Internet Options**, click **Local Intranet**, click **Sites**, and disable **Automatically detect intranet network**.
trans-unit.target: As a workaround, open the **Security** tab of **Internet Options**, click **Local Intranet**, click **Sites**, and disable **Automatically detect intranet network**.

trans-unit.source: Remember to change this setting back when you are done testing.
trans-unit.target: Remember to change this setting back when you are done testing.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with HTML/JavaScript in [Mobile Services HTML/JavaScript How-to Conceptual Reference]
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with HTML/JavaScript in [Mobile Services HTML/JavaScript How-to Conceptual Reference]

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
